content.rendered:
Tuesday February 5th, 2025 

Today is an “A” Day 

 

 

Club Meetings and Information 

 

Time to order your 2025 Yearbook! Sales are pre-order ONLY! Use the link on the Maple Avenue Webpage or in the flyer sent home. 

There will be a student council meeting on Wednesday 2.5.25 in Mrs. Kerls room. 

Attention grade 6 and 7 students: Join us for a Virtual STEM Information Night to explore the exciting course options in math, science, and technology at the middle school. This live event will cover program pathways information about math and science acceleration opportunities. The livestream will be posted on ParentSquare and the Maple website. 

Redeem your LiveSchool points from February 4th to 7th. Orders arrive next week. Keep following the 4 Bs to earn more points and make Maple Avenue a great place! 

Attention Pop Culture Icon Club – We will be meeting tomorrow, February 5, after school in the Large Group Room. Please let Ms. Schnorr know if you need a late bus pass. 

The Maple Avenue Musical Club proudly announces its production of Matilda featuring 73 talented students from Maple Avenue! The show will take place on Friday, February 7 at 7:00 PM; Saturday, February 8 at 1:00 PM & 7:00 PM. Tickets are on sale now through the QR code on the posters placed around school or online. Tickets will also be available at the door. The cost is just $5 for students. We hope to see you there! 

In honor of the Super Bowl this weekend with the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles, this Friday will be Jersey Day! It’s okay if you’re not a football fan – wear YOUR favorite jersey from your favorite sports team, or your favorite team’s colors! OR, for those Taylor Swift fans here at Maple Ave, dress from your favorite era! 

Attention grade 6 and 7 students: Join us for a Virtual STEM Information Night on February 10th to explore the exciting course options in math, science, and technology at the middle school. This live event will cover program pathways information about math and science acceleration opportunities. The livestream will be posted on ParentSquare and the Maple website 

Attention Grade 6 and 7 Students Interested in Accelerated Math and/or Science: Testing will occur on March 5 for science and March 20 for math. Your parents or guardians need to register you by Friday, February 28, using the ParentSquare form. As a reminder, grade 7 students already in accelerated math and/or science do not take the placement tests. 

Math Club will not be meeting this week. The next Math Club meeting is on Wednesday, 2/12 in room R232. 

Any boy interested in playing Modified Lacrosse should attend a very important informational meeting on Monday February 10th at 2:25 in Gym B. You should plan on having a ride home as the meeting will be done by 3:00.  Schedules and other important information will be provided.  See Coach Durant with any questions.   

On Thursday, February 6th you will have the pleasure of seeing our Maple students in action when they perform select scenes from the musical, Matilda. Performances will take place during grade level flexes only.   

Peer Mentors will be meeting in cafeteria #2 today at 2:30. 

There is a voice club meeting today after school in the Chorus room. You do not have to be in chorus to join us! We will be creating a new winter warm up and working on NYSSMA solos. 

Reminder that everyone is responsible for having an ID badge bus tag. If you do not have one, or your badge is not working, please see Ms. Lorenz in the Columbian Springs House Office. The cost for a new badge is $5. 

The No Place for Hate “Project Planning” group is meeting after school today in room 236. The No Place for Hate “Quick Impact” group is meeting after school in room 139. Please go directly to one of those two rooms at 2:35. 

Update on the LiveSchool Shop – the link to place orders will close at the end of the day on Thursday February 5th. Please get your orders in ASAP. 

 

 Check out the Maple Avenue Club Calendar for club meetings and room information! 
 

As always, BE SAFE, BE RESPECTFUL, BE RESPONSIBLE, BE KIND!  

Make it a great day, or not…the choice is yours.
